title: The Story of the Statue
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 695 words, Level P (Grade 2), Lexile 670L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     J and M
description: On an island in New York Harbor stands a very big, green, famous lady-the Statue of Liberty! Readers will learn many interesting facts about where she came from and how she was built. They will also learn what she means to the people of the United States. Engaging photographs support the text.
highFrequencyWords: Declaration of Independence, donate, engineer, freedom, independence, liberty, model, monument, pedestal, sculptor, symbol, yearning
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Proper Nouns                : Recognize and use proper nouns
awareness: Syllable Patterns                : Understand and use syllable patterns to divide two- and three-syllable words
phonics:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
